required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Combining Cereals With Pulses - Reduced Gastrointestinal Symptoms?
clinical_study.official_title: Combining Cereals With Pulses - Reduced Gastrointestinal Symptoms?

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to compare self-reported gastrointestinal symptoms and intestinal fermentation rates of the study products as measured by breath hydrogen and methane in adult population with self-reported mild abdominal sensitivity to pulses. The study products are a pulse products with two different cereals.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is a randomized, controlled, double-blind, cross-over intervention trial. The aim is to recruit 25 subjects to the trial. The study will be conducted with a cross-over setting, where the subjects will go through exposure meals and breath gas measurement two times (two different test products) in a randomized order. The study meals are identical in appearance but differ in fiber content. After study breakfast the breath gases are analyzed every 15 minutes during 8 hours.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Breath hydrogen and methane are measured by Gastrocheck device.

secondary_outcome.description: Gastrointestinal symptoms as measured as questionnaires.

clinical_study.condition: Unidentified Gastrointestinal Symptoms Following Pulses Consumption

arm_group.description: Pulses and cereal 1 containing study product is served. Dietary intervention.
Pulses and cereal 2 containing study product is served. Dietary intervention.

intervention.description: Dietary intervention. Ingestion of pulses with cereals and gastrointestinal health.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects with subjective experience of gut symptoms after consumption of pulses
- Celiac disease and wheat allergy excluded by antigen test
- Age 18-65
- BMI 18,5 - 30
- Normal liver, thyroid and kidney functions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Celiac disease, Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis or acute diverticulitis
- Any medication affecting the gastrointestinal tract (e.g. laxatives and acid-suppressive drugs)
- Antibiotic treatment within previous 3 months
- Blood donation or participation to another clinical trial within one month prior to study entry

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Biochemistry, University of Turku

facility.name: Department of Biochemistry, University of Turku
